title: Modifying Law Determining Missions, Organisation and Functioning of the National Commission for Human Rights
title_en: Modifying Law Determining Missions, Organisation and Functioning of the National Commission for Human Rights

provisions.title: Article 1 - Approval for ratification
provisions.content: The Agreement on Trade and Economic Cooperation between the Government of the Republic of Turkey and the Government of the Republic of Rwanda, signed in Istanbul, Turkey, on 3 November 2016, in annex, is approved for ratification.

provisions.title: Article 2 - Drafting, consideration and
provisions.content: adoption of this Law This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Ikinyarwanda.

provisions.title: Article 3 - Commencement

II: RESPONSIBILITIES OF COMMISSION 5: Responsibilities Commission is responsible for the of the to verify whether public institutions recruit staff using a transparent and equitable candidate selection system; to analyse reports on staff recruitment competitions organized by public institutions and placement of staff; to verify whether public institutions comply with laws, regulations and decisions relating to the management of public servants; to promote professional conduct and behaviour in the public service as well as how public servants fulfil their obligations in accordance with human resources management laws; to carry out research on human resource management and on entities providing public services in order to make recommendations to Government; to make final decisions on administrative actions related to human Resources management which are brought to it on appeal. III: ORGANIZATION AND OF THE COMMISSION 6: Governance organs of the Commission is composed of the governance organs: the Council of Commissioners; the Bureau of the Commission; the Executive Secretariat. It has the following to make follow-up on the fulfilment of the performance of the responsibilities of the Commission; to make follow-up on the management of public servants and the property of the Commission; to approve the action plan and activity report of the Commission; to assign the staff of the Commission to positions that are within its powers and in accordance with the relevant laws; to approve the draft budget proposal of the Commission and follow up the budget implementation; to provide advice and take decisions enabling the Commission to fulfil its responsibilities; to approve the rules and regulations of the Commission. 11: Benefits granted to members of Council of Commissioners Presidential Order determines benefits to the members of the Council of 12: Grounds for loss of membership the Council of Commissioners member of the Council of Commissioners his/her office for one of the following expiry of the term of office; if he/she can no longer perform his/her duties due to physical or mental disability duly confirmed by an authorized medical doctor; written notification resignation; of voluntary if he/she no longer fulfils the requirements considered at the time of his/her appointment to the Council of Commissioners; if he/she demonstrates unworthy of his/her duties; behaviour if he/she acts against the interests of the Commission; three (3) consecutive unjustified absences from meetings of the Commission within a year; death. of a Commissioner is tendered to President of the Republic by registered mail or by letter hand-delivered with of receipt.
